remarks: An isomorphism in the category of rings is a bijection.  (Contributed by AV, 14-Feb-2020.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
ringcsectOLD.c $e |- C = ( RingCatOLD ` U ) $.
ringcsectOLD.b $e |- B = ( Base ` C ) $.
ringcsectOLD.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. V ) $.
ringcsectOLD.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
ringcsectOLD.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. B ) $.
ringcisoOLD.n $e |- I = ( Iso ` C ) $.
ringcisoOLD $p |- ( ph -> ( F e. ( X I Y ) <-> F e. ( X RingIso Y ) ) ) $.
